data_usage: Decadal average temperature anomalies (difference between the decade and the 1901-1960 average temperature) for each U.S. region were plotted as a line graph. Note: the 2000s decade contains data for 12 years (2001-2012).
methodology: Annual mean temperatures were averaged for all gridpoints in each of the six contiguous U.S. regions. Decadal averages were then calculated. Finally the 1901-1960 average temperature was subtracted from the decadal average temperature. These decadal temperature anomalies were then plotted as a line graph for each region.
